intro: Psychotria sarmiensis, commonly known as the Sarmiento psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical rainforests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological significance.
